oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of The Confederate Soldiers Home, Hermitage, Tennessee, circa 1910
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of The Confederate Soldiers Home, on the grounds of The Hermitage, home of President Andrew Jackson. The home opened on 12 May 1892 and provided shelter, comfort and medical attention to almost 700 veterans during its 41 years of service. The cemetery, on the lawn of the Hermitage Presbyterian Church, contains the graves of 487 men. The home closed on 22 November 1933. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : sepia ; 5.5 x 7.5 in., mounted on cardboard.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tennessee Confederate Soldiers' Home; Hermitage (Hermitage, Tenn.)
